results.title: Japan: traditions & trends in the 80's - Yrs 9-12
results.brief_description: A generally informative program that gives an overview to Japan in four main areas: 1. Rituals and religion. 2.Economy. 3. Technology. 4. Policy for the People. Each segment could be viewed separately.

results.title: Australian identity. Yrs 7-10
results.brief_description: A program presented in ten segments on the Australian identity. 1. What’s an identity? 2. What’s an Australian? 3. Popular legends. 4. Aboriginal identity. 5. People left out of our legends. 6. Defiance of authority. 7. The Anzac legend. 8. White colonial Australia. 9. Legends about women. 10. Changing national identity. Uses extracts from early Australian feature films and stills to focus on the question of who are Australians.

results.title: Study techniques
results.brief_description: Shows the difficulties that some postprimary students have in effectively organising their study times. Suggests how to balance the conflicting needs of sport, socialising and other leisure activities with study. Also shows techniques for effective study and mentions the skim, read and make notes, personalise, summarise and revise methods.

results.title: Last stand
results.creator_credit: Frank Rijavec, Claire Calzoni and Coalition for Denmark's Environment (W.A.)
results.brief_description: Western Australia had 5% forest cover at settlement. In 150 years that has been reduced to just 1%. “Last Stand” is a critical examination of south Western Australia’s natural forest reserves and present forest practices which threatens the remaining ancient Karri Forests. It sounds a timely warning that whole areas af Australia’s wilderness will be lost to future generations if short term commercial gain is the sole criteria for their management.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Frank Rijavec, Claire Calzoni and Coalition for Denmark’s Environment (W.A.)

results.title: Anzac Day: World War 1
results.brief_description: Richard Morecroft presents an overview of Australian involvementt in World War I, concentrating primarily on the Gallipoli campaign. Provides background history ot the war, the reasons for Australia’s involvement, and details the events at Gallipoli whilst mentioning the arenas of combat in which Australian soldiers fought. Uses stills, archival footage, footage from propaganda and feature films related to World War I. Useful background to the story of Anzac Day, mentioning Simpson and his donkey, Turkish bravery and perceptions of the war. (SCHOOL PROGRAM ON THE GREAT WAR-SUITABLE FOR PRIMARY SCHOOL CHILDREN)

results.title: Animal alphabet parade
results.creator_credit: John Williams and Stewart Hardy Films
results.brief_description: An animated production that presents a segment on each letter of the alphabet. A magician introduces a rapid succession of words beginning with the particular letter. Despite the fact that the words used are phonetically quite complex, the overall rich choice of language could be a useful tool for language development. Note that the writing technique demonstrated for each letter is not that used for Victoria.

results.title: The Boy and the snow goose
results.creator_credit: Gayle Thomas and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A delightful animated story about the friendship between a boy and a snow goose. The call of nature is strong and the essence of the friendship is tested as the boy and the goose must follow their own instincts.

results.title: Into everything: providing for toddlers in child care
results.creator_credit: Alex Jaye and Video Media Production
results.brief_description: Shows how the developmental stages of pre-kindergarten children can be positively influenced by the provision of appropriate adult support and facilities in child care. Aimed at chilcare providers with little or no knowledge of cognitive and emotional stages of child development. This video emphasises that safe, colourful, cheerful and organised programs of care best facilitate proper psychomotor development. Appropriate for Professional Development and Personal Development (Home Economics).

results.title: Project out of school: planning a quality service
results.creator_credit: Alex Jaye, Maryla Juchnowski, Suzanne Cecil-Fizdale and Video Media Production
results.brief_description: Provides the considerations for planning quality out of school programs both before and after school. Shows a number of active programs, emphasises the advantages of holding such programs, and illustrates ways of involving parents, children and staff. Appropriate for Professional Development and Personal Development (Home Economics) at VCE level

results.title: To learn day by day
results.creator_credit: Alex Jaye and Video Media Production
results.brief_description: Offers advice to child care providers on appropriate strategies to facilitate the learning of basic concepts such as big, round, etc. as well as number games and colours. Provides a strategy which involves starting with concepts and moving on to comparisons. Appropriate for professional Development and personal development (Home Economics) at VCE level.
